tit.j: 日本の鬼の交流博物館
tit.e: Nihonn no Oni no Koryu Museum (Japanese Oni Museum)
tit.cmt: 日本の鬼の交流博物館→Japanese Oni Museum[定訳不明
tit.e: Nihon no Oni no Koryu Museum (Japanese Oni Museum)
Nihon no Oni no Koryu Museum (Japanese Oni Museum)

sen.j: 日本の鬼の交流博物館（にほんのおにのこうりゅうはくぶつかん）は、京都府福知山市（旧加佐郡大江町）の大江山麓にある鬼伝説をテーマとする博物館。
sen.e: Nihonn no Oni no Koryu Museum (日本の鬼の交流博物館) (Japanese Oni Museum) is a museum featuring Oni (demons) Legend located at the foot of Oe-yama Mountain in (former Oe Cho, Kasa Gun) Fkuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture.

Nihon no Oni no Koryu Museum (日本の鬼の交流博物館) (Japanese Oni Museum) is a museum featuring Oni (demon) legends, and is located at the foot of Oe-yama Mountain in Fukuchiyama City (former Oe Cho, Kasa Gun), Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 「Nihonn」→「Nihon」,「demons」→「demon」, 「Legend」→「legends」, 「, and is」挿入,「Fkuchiyama」→「Fukuchiyama」, 「(former Oe Cho, Kasa Gun」箇所異動
sen.e: Nihon no Oni no Koryu Museum (日本の鬼の交流博物館) (Japanese Oni Museum) is a museum featuring Oni (demon) legends, and is located at the foot of Mt.Oe in Fukuchiyama City (former Oe-cho, Kasa-gun), Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: Mt. Oe, Oe-cho, Kasa-gun としました。

sen.j: 大江山には3つの鬼伝説が残されている。
sen.e: Oe-yama Mountain has three Oni legends.
Oe-yama Mountain has three Oni legends.
Mt. Oe has three Oni legends.

sen.j: この伝説を”町おこし”の起爆剤として活用すべく、廃坑となった銅鉱山の跡地に1993年4月に開館した。
sen.e: It was opened at a deserted copper mine in April 1993 in an attempt to use these legends to trigger "machi-okoshi" or revitalizing the town's economy.
It was opened at a deserted copper mine in April 1993 in an attempt to use these legends to trigger "machi-okoshi" or revitalizing the town's economy.

sen.j: 外観は鬼の力強さや挑戦的なイメージを表現したRC造平屋建ての建造物で、建築面積は639.81平米。
sen.e: It is one storied reinforced-concrete (RC) structure, with its exterior expressing strong and challenging Oni, and its building area occupies 639.81 m2.
It is a one storied reinforced-concrete (RC) structure, with its exterior depicting strong and challenging Oni, occupying 639.81 m2.

sen.e: It is a one storied reinforced-concrete (RC) structure, with its exterior depicting strong and challenging Oni, occupying 639.81square meters.

sen.j: 内部は200人収容の「鬼の交流ホール」を中心とした回廊に展示スペースが設けられている。
sen.e: It houses "Oni no Koryu Hall" at the center with 200 capacity seats, and its surrounding corridor provides displays.
It houses "Oni no Koryu Hall" at its center with a seating capacity of 200, and its surrounding corridor contains displays.

sen.j: 全国あるいは世界中の伝統芸能やそこで用いられる面、人形あるいは屏風画などを展示。
sen.e: Masks and dolls used by performing arts in the world, and paintings on folding screens are displayed.
There are displays of dolls, masks and paintings on folding screens used in performing arts both nationally and internationally.

sen.j: 「祀られる鬼」「仏と鬼」「神楽の鬼」「暮らしの中の鬼」「追われる鬼」「民俗芸能の鬼」など鬼の多面性について紹介する。
sen.e: It explains multiple aspects of Oni: 'Enshrined Oni': 'Oni and Buddha': 'Oni in Shinto misic and dances': 'Oni in our everyday life': 'Oni running away from us': 'Oni and folklore.'
It illustrates the many facets of Oni, such as: 'Enshrined Oni': 'Oni and Buddha': 'Oni in Shinto misic and dances': 'Oni in our everyday life': 'Oni running away from us': 'Oni and folklore.'

sen.e: Here displayed are about 50 items of Onigawara with signatures including replicas in the chronological order from Asuka Period (7c) to today.
